Reviews.Title: “A Five Star MOTEL, Not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VampireNanny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spinnaker for a desperately needed last minute getaway Sunday Sept 9 to Tues Sept 11, based on other tripadvisor reviews and a clean bedbug report. Our go to place to stay in OC is the Hilton, but they were not only prohibitively expensive still at this time of year, they were booked. I am normally an ocean front balcony only gal, but decided to give this a try since the price and availability were right, and cleanliness is an absolute MUST. I booked us a deluxe efficiency, non smoking room and asked for the popular room 410. Since it was less than 24 hrs until our arrival, I was pleased to be able to get a booking, and pleasantly surprised to receive a call less than ten minutes later from the front desk there asking if room 408 would suffice instead, as room 410 was occupied. Upon our arrival, check in was fast and efficient. We used a handy luggage cart, navigated the much maligned elevators, which while old and a bit lurchy upon docking at the designated floor, were certainly not as bad as reported, and arrived at our room. The room was an adequate size, with two double beds, a pullout couch, a table and chairs for four. A galley kitchenette, and a fair sized bathroom rounded out the room. Everything was CLEAN, fresh and inviting. The view from our balcony was an unobstructed side view of ocean, very nice. It does get the sun all afternoon though which may limit its use for some. The kitchenette was stocked with basics: dishes, glasses, mugs, pans, flatware, basic cooking utensils, dish towel and cloth, dish soap.. Plan your coking needs ahead, pack thoughtfully, always remember a sharp knife (even at the Hilton!), condiments, oil, food wrap, salt and pepper etc. Water was hot enough to do good job on dirty dishes. Bathroom had toiletries, plenty of white clean motel grade towels in good condition, counter space, hair dryer with night light and huge mirror. Water pressure in shower was better than many places, adequate. Kleenex and toilet paper is standard sandpaper motel grade. Beds are firm and smooth, linens white and fresh. We always push double beds together if there is no king bed, and since these were on wheels, that's what we did. The pillows were bouncy, not flat and tired. We slept fine, albeit feet hanging off the end because double beds just aren't long enough for most modern era adults. There is a handy, easy to use roomy safe in the room which we used for iPad, Xbox etc . The pool was clean, a pleasant size, heated to a dreamy temperature, open until 9pm. Perfect. We will absolutely stay here again, particularly after the season in September, when rates are low and the ocean is such a pleasant temperature after the long hot summer. My only complaint is the sodium light on the balcony that came on at dusk and was not able to be turned off. Even with curtains closed, the light was intrusive. We shut the room divider halfway at night to block it off.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JMCH513
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Spinnaker over the weekend (Sept. 7 - 9) and had a wonderful stay! The room was clean. All balconies have a view of the ocean. My daughter loved it. Office staff was helpful -- problems with one of the room keys were resolved within ten minutes. The hotel is not directly on the boardwalk -- there is another hotel between the Spinnaker and the beach -- but all that means is that you still have all the convenience of the boardwalk with none of the noise. We took advantage of their late checkout policy so we could leave at our leisure rather than rush to be out of the room at 11:00am -- the hotel was perfectly accommodating to our wishes. They were also very helpful in recommending places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel room was complete with a small kitchenette, so bringing food to cook is certainly an option. The only slight negative was indeed the bed size. My husband is over six feet and the beds did not really accommodate his size. However, the convenience of the location and the proficiency and friendliness of staff (and the cleanliness of the room) are all reasons we will stay here again when we return to Ocean City.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Old Bridge, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “One of the best spots to stay in OC, bar none!”
Reviews.Author: Todd G
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here from Tuesday, 9/4/12 through Friday, 9/7/12, and we couldn't have asked for a better place. Spinnaker puts you right on top of the boardwalk and you are within a short drive from the major attractions in all of OC. The cool part is when you step out on the balcony and look to the left all you can see is the calmness and relaxation of the beach. When you see the palm trees and the sunset you know you have made it to your getaway place. We both liked that they gave you hard and soft pillows for the beds so you could pick which was best for you. The beds were also comfortable, and while some may think that they're small, were actually big enough for us. The pool (on level 1) was clean and warm, and it was a good thing to have because there were rip currents on the ocean which made the ocean too dangerous to swim. We had breakfast at Malia's Cafe on Thursday morning, but while the food was good, we decided Layton's on 16th was our go to for the remainder of the trip. Our housekeeper, Monica, also did a great job cleaning the room every day. Overall, though, we were extremely satisfied staying here and would come back on our next trip down! We picked Spinnaker based on the reviews from here (it was #2 when we booked at the beginning of July and no worse than #3 when we stayed), and are extremely grateful to everyone who had reviewed this and helped make our choice easier.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth stay at the Spinnaker”
Reviews.Author: bedford123
Reviews.Content: After 30 years of going to Ocean City for summer vacations we have settled on the Spinnaker as our favorite motel. Pros: Great location (on the Boardwalk at 18th street- easy walk to the Boardwalk activities but still at a quiet area), cleanliness, large rooms (2 doubles, sofabed & kitchenette), oceanview balconies, reasonable price, walking distance to good restaurants. Cons: small beds, small bathroom, some rooms permit smoking (we had a no-smoking room but the guests at the adjoining room smoked on the balcony beside us). We spent Labor Day weekend at the Spinnaker for our 5th stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait till next summer to stay at Spinnaker Motel OC,Md.”
Reviews.Author: KAREN993
Reviews.Content: Was my first vac. in oc, felt very confertable & safe staying at Spinnaker,nice clean rooms,staff very nice,I like that the pool is on 2nd level,not street level.Close to beach & boardwalk,def be back next summer,can't wait . :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay At The Spinnaker!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine G
Reviews.Content: My family were guest at the Spinnaker from Aug 23rd thru the 29th. We had 4 rooms on the second floor which we thought were great. We had good view of the ocean and the sights below as we were not too high. When I booked the room I was told the 4th and 5th floor were remodeled but they cost more so I declined. Never mind. I was quite pleased with the rooms. They were large and the beds were so comfy!! Each bed had 4 pillows which you hardly see. Maid service was good. Our maid was Monica who did an okay job cleaning the room. I find she did a better job once she knew us but hey that's just me. The hotel staff at front desk were great. Gave us good directions to local spots. Staff did a great job clesning the hotel grounds and pool. The only complaint I would have is no ice machines so you have to buy some but it is great to have a kitchen so the families with us with children could cook. We all went to the Walmart and stocked our room with all sorts of goodies. This way you can save with breakfast and eat 2 or even 1 meal out. The cafe on site served very good breakfast even though service was slow. We had a ball and I will stay at the this hotel again. We enjoyed the large balconies which had 2 chairs and a table. We sat out at night talking and people watched. This hotel is steps from the beach and boardwalk. The pool has a really large sitting area with tables and umbrellas. I wish they would make the pool a little larger as it is rather small but still a nice clean pool. No one can go wrong with this great spot so try it!!! I like staying at really nice hotels and the Spinnaker filled the bill. Nice clean and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in OC”
Reviews.Author: john928
Reviews.Content: My first time in OC. Usually stay in Wildwood. The hotel was nice and clean and a very good location. Price was reasonable for a beach location. View of the ocean is limited from the room. I have to say this hotel has one of the most comfortable beds I ever slept in at a beach hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: PATraverler
Reviews.Content: I searched for weeks to find a hotel in Ocean City. Finding Spinnaker Motel was well worth the search. This place is great! The price is reasonable and the rooms are spacious and very clean. The location is only 1/2 block from the boardwalk and is far enough up so that it is not overly crowded on the beach. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating, allowing us to leave our cell phone number so they could call us when our room was ready. Last, but by no means least, is Alice, our housekeeper. She was helpful, pleasant and turned a good day into a great one with her charming personality and daily greeting. We will definitely be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We love to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: streakerscowgurl
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Spinnaker last year and booked again this year. Clean rooms which are good size and an easy walk to the beach and boardwalk. The staff is super friendly, helpful and right ON any problem you might have. One of the things I REALLY love is that you can check in and park, use their bathroom/changing room, and hit the pool or beach at any time before check in. I will definitely continue to stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Riss246
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel, it is half a block from the beach/boardwark. The rooms are clean and a decent size. We had an efficiency plus, there were two double beds, a table with 4 chairs, and a kitchen. The bathroom was a little small. The beds are really comfortable. Alice the housekeeper greeted us a with a smile every morning. We enjoyed seeing her every day. The location is close enough to the boardwalk to walk, but far enough away from the busy end to be nice and quiet. The staff is super friendly, we had a problem with our key and maintenance came up right away and fixed it. I would reccommend this motel to anyone visiting Ocean City. We are planning to stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrcook322
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a great place to stay and is well kept and affordable this is the place. Wife and I have been staying here for years you wont find a better value and well maintain property. The office staff are amazing especially Anita she goes above her duties to make sure your stay is enjoyable. So next time your looking for a place give them a try in my opinion you cant go wrong. Cant wait to see the Spinnaker gang in 28 days for Sunfest

Reviews.Title: “Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Jayman1
Reviews.Content: Im writing this review as im stitting on the balcony at the Spinnaker hotel to let all who read this that this hotel is the place for you if cleanliness and refreshingly friendly service is what you're looking for. The room was immaculate and alot larger than your average sized hotel rooms. Everyone from the women working at the front desk to the maids were pleasant and more than eager to be of assistance to us. Im not one to write reviews but feel this hotel is deserving of a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location – Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: LBiship
Reviews.Content: I want to start by stating we have been coming to Ocean City for 30 plus years but always stay in a condo rental. We decided to take our granddaughters on a mini vacation for three days and selected this motel based on the reviews. I did see two negative reviews but didn’t give them much merit because the majority was very positive. We stayed on the 5th floor and had a wonderful view of both the ocean and the bay. The balcony is very large and can hold quite a few people comfortably. If someone were smoking on the adjacent balconies I don’t think you would be able to smell it because there are dividers on both sides. We asked for a non-smoking room but none were available however we did not smell any kind of odors and they had even offered to put in a smoke removal machine prior to our arrival but we declined since we knew it had a balcony and we could get fresh air if needed. The room was spacious (I included a few pictures) and well decorated. It was VERY clean so I really don’t understand the two reviews that went on about how dirty this place was. There was no smell of mildew, mold or any other offending odors. The AC cooled the room very well. The beds were very comfortable; the sheets were incredible soft and four very fluffy pillows per bed. There was a divider you could pull (picture included) so if anyone were sleeping in the sofa area there was privacy for both areas. There was a nice table and chairs, a flat screen TV with plenty of cable channels. The wifi speed was average for any hotel/motel. The small kitchen was very clean as well as plenty of adequate dishes and pots. The bathroom was a little on the small side but clean with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The pool area was very nice with a large deck and numerous tables and chairs. The boardwalk and beach was a short block away and we took the train to the pier one night which was fun. The beach area was nice and not too crowded. A couple negative items: I have to say is the parking was a pain if you had to park after 8:00 PM there was nothing available. We did go ask the front desk and she was kind enough to come outside and find us a makeshift parking space behind the café but we were a bit nervous leaving our Infiniti there because we were afraid someone would back into it the way it was positioned. The 2nd negative would be the elevator door closed a bit quick and hard for my liking. I made sure my granddaughters were in first because I was afraid it could close on them. The 3rd would be the café. We had breakfast there the first morning and the service was extremely slow and there were not even that many customers there at the time. The food was just ok; but there are much better breakfast places in OC so I would not eat there again. I can’t comment on housekeeping because I don’t let them in my rooms at any hotel however I did see them scrubbing the floors in the rooms (so they do clean) and they were very pleasant and always made a point of greeting you. If I ever need a motel again I would definitely stay here for the money. It’s much more affordable than other comparable motels in the area and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: divalicious1
Reviews.Content: My family and I (3 adults and 2 children under 10) just returned from a 6 night stay at this property. We had an efficiency with an ocean view balcony. We arrived Sunday afternoon before the check in time and were given the keys to the room. The staff was very friendly in their greeting. The front desk staff was the best. They answered all of my questions and made suggestions for activities and meals for us. All of the locations they suggested were superb. Unfortunately I did not write down the names of the staff members. As for the room, it was clean. And we had room to move around, even when the pull out couch was opened. The table and chairs were handy when we had our meals in the room. We never had a problem when we requested extra pillows, blankets and towels from housekeeping. The efficiency location was perfect for viewing the ocean and people watching. We enjoyed the view and had room for all 5 of us on the balcony. The pool was always busy as many guests enjoyed this location after a day at the beach. The adajacent area to the pool was good for sunbathing, having lunch or meeting with friends and family. It was a large area with umbrellas and tables for the guests to enjoy. The maintenance crew was very visible during our stay keeping the property spruced up and clean. Each morning, the staff cleaned the pool area. We did have one meal at the onsite cafe. It was ok. Overall, I was very pleased with the experience. The location was good, the noise level was very low, the beach was very close and steps off the property, parking was onsite and was not an issue finding a space each day, bike rental was close by, buffets were within walking distance, sit down meals were within walking distance. We will visit this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie S
Reviews.Content: My family and I vacationed at the Spinnaker Motel in mid-August and it was a very good experience. One block from the boardwalk and very clean rooms. The beds were comfortable and clean...the fridge came in handy and the view from room 518 was wonderful. After an awful experience at another hotel last year, this was a very pleasant surprise. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: alval728
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first visit to Ocean City where we stayed at the Spinnaker (mid-30's couple with no kids). The best part of this hotel was the location - the beach and boardwalk are less than a block away, just north of some of the busier areas. We were able to walk or take the tram to the southern part of the boardwalk (busier area with rides, etc) but it was nice to be staying in a quieter/less congested area. Our room was near spotless so I am confused by some of the negative reviews. Per usual, we didn't have housekeeping come to clean our room during our stay (we like our privacy). However, the staff were very friendly as we passed them in the hallways and asked us if there was anything we needed. The front desk staff was also very helpful with recommendations and information to answer all of my various questions upon check-in :-) They were even accomodating when we asked to extend our stay. Unfortunately, we would have had to switch rooms and ended up deciding to stick with our original plan and return home. We arrived well before check-in and stayed for the afternoon on the day of check-out and were able to park in the motel lot and utilize the changing rooms so that we could get in as much beach time as possible. In summary, we have both stayed at some high end and basic hotels. While this is not a high end hotel, we didn't expect it to be. It is in a great location with clean rooms, friendly/helpful staff and it is a good value. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kymbab
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned today from a two night stay. We were in an efficiency on the 5th floor with a wonderful view of the beach from the private balcony. The room was spotless, and very large. The beds were very comfortable and nice bathroom, kitchen area as well. Our bathroom had a complete set of toiletries. This is an older motel, but our room was obviously retovated recently. Location is excellent, not as crazy as boardwalk locations downtown area. The cafe has a wonderful lunch as well!! Def. will return here , well worth the money!! Staff at front desk were Fantastic as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Holly_Traveler_9
Reviews.Content: It is nicer than the average motel. Kitchenette was spotless. Nice balcony view and one block from the boardwalk. Pool was nicer than expected. Shower pressure was a little weak and the bathroom was pretty tiny, despite that the room was larger than the average hotel room. Check in was a little disorganized for lack of an official line but the front desk staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My family loved the Spinnaker!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbissell
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, daughter, and myself stayed in a very clean efficiency on the 5th floor. I am a neat freak, and even I thought the room was really clean. The beds were very comfy, the pool & sundeck were great, and the location was perfect!! The staff was nice, especially our wonderful housekeeper, Miss Alice! We will be staying here again!! The only thing that wasn't up to par was the bath towels......they are old, thin, and stained.....PLEASE REPLACE THEM!!! THEN I won't have any complaints =)

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: las530
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Spinnaker on August 5-9, 2012. There were 5 of us. 2 adults & three teens. The location was great. Steps from the boardwalk. The rooms were nice and very clean. Very quiet. Bathroom is a bit small for 5 people but we managed. We had breakfast one morning at the cafe, BEST bacon egg & cheese sandwich that I have ever had! We were having such a good time that we wanted to stay an extra night but unfortunetly they did not have one room available. So we had to go elsewhere. We went next door to the Siharra. What a mistake!!! Smelly Dump!!! Doesn't compare to the Spinnaker. WE WOULD ABSOLUTELY STAY AT THE SPINNAKER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jm2009Pa
Reviews.Content: The location is great...on the beach and the quiet end of the boardwalk. The service was great and the room was clean. We stayed for 4 nights and on the 4th night we had to change rooms because we had only booked 3. The first 3 nights we were on the second floor and it was great, the 4th night we moved to the 1st floor and it was not as clean and a little more noisy but it was still not bad. There is a small cafe on the premises for breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overrated”
Reviews.Author: MagDen007
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation at the beginning of February for a stay of five nights in August. We booked a non smoking unit ocean view efficiency. We arrived around 3:30 to take possession of the room. None was available. We were first offered a room in the North unit, with no view on the first floor. After my refusal, they offered us a room on the second floor, adjacent to the street. I had to remind them the date which I made my reservation, so I could expect a room with a view on higher floor. Finally we got an oceanside room on the third floor. The room wasn’t clean at all: walls, doors, cabinets, switches, the refrigerator were all dirty. We could barely see out the windows. We went to the grocery store to get bleach Lysol, Febreze for the cleanup and remove odors. This is our second visit to Ocean City. We chose this hotel for the kitchen and good reviews. I still do not understand that there are such good reviews. We also had to get some cooking pans, because them were not usable. The beds are uncomfortable. The housekeeper does the strict minimum, emptied the trash and put the sheets. No shampoo is provided. People smoke on the balconies, so we didn’t sit outside at any time. Last year we were at the Park Place Hotel and the rules of not smoking were more respected. Furthermore, although a bit more expensive, the hotel and the rooms were by far much cleaner there. Our last time at the Spinnaker.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here, bring your own cleaning supplies....”
Reviews.Author: CrystalWV_12
Reviews.Content: To our own fault, we waited a bit too long to make reservations for our annual beach trip so our original hotel was booked for the time frame we could go. We read some reviews on here reporting the great service, updated/clean rooms, etc. at the Spinnaker so we thought we would try it out. We are NOT high maintenance people but we DO expect a clean room. To say that our room was filthy would be an understatement (and before thinking we just got a "bad" room I checked my parents room as well...same thing). The bathroom had a stench of mildew and something I couldn't quite describe until I lifted the shower curtain and discovered a stain that could only be some sort of vomit. I took the shower curtain down and had my husband take it down to exchange for a new one. The tub had remnants of the previous tenants (hair, sand, slivers of soap). (We knew we were stuck with the room because of NO refunds so we tried to make the best of the situation.) We requested new towels because the ones in the room were damp and smelled of mildew. I needed to strip the beds as hair and sand were EVERYWHERE. The floors were stained and after a quick scrub of the kitchen floor I found pills that had been dropped and not swept up. Needless to say we didn't use ANYTHING in the kitchen unit. With two children in the room, it was alarming that we found remnants of liquor caps, strange stains/food/etc. wiped on the walls and sticky refrigerator handles. We had to make a trip to the nearest CVS for cleaning supplies where I proceeded to clorox the bathroom/tub and wipe down the entire room. I wouldn't even let my children sit on the couch because it was so stained. We didn't place anything in the drawers because the whole room was filthy. The beds were listed as "queen" but they were certainly full-sized (and we didn't even attempt the sofa bed as it was filthy.) Our feet hung out over the bed so be prepared if you are tall OR you were expecting a queen-sized bed. While wiping down the dining table, I moved it a bit and the leg about fell off...it was surreal. The air conditioning unit in the room had black mold coming out and around the filter/unit. I bleached and wiped as much of the mess as I could. All in all we attempted to stay out of the room as much as possible (thank goodness the motel is so close to the beach and boardwalk). I'm a little shocked that this motel received such great reviews. Again, we are pretty reasonable people but it was a little much to have such a dirty room. We didn't even request room service because we just cleaned everything ourselves. I will say that the staff was accommodating to bring new linens and towels and I am not sure they had much control over the situation. I don't know if the motel staff were rushed, didn't have the right cleaning supplies, they may not have enough help or what but the rooms could definitely use some major work. The "renovations" are extremely cheaply done. This room may have worked for a college crew that didn't really care about cleanliness but for a family of four (with young kids) it was a nightmare. Lesson learned...we are already making our reservations for next year's trip because we don't want to be stuck with motel options like this one. :o(

Reviews.Title: “A great little place and great location”
Reviews.Author: Steph7168
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights recently. The location was great, quiet but still close to all the action on the boardwalk. The walk to the beach took less then 1 minute - which was awesome. The rooms were clean for the most part. The hotel is very dated, but for the price you can not complain. The staff was fantastic! There is a great little cafe called Malia's Place attached to the hotel. We had breakfast there every morning and the staff and food were both excellent. This was a bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Lesa13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights recently. The location is good, very short walk to the boardwalk and beach. It's close enough to walk to the main busy part of the boardwalk but far enough away to be quiet. The outside is a little dated but everything was clean. Our 5th floor room had a nice view of both the ocean and the bay. The balcony was a good size as well. We fit 4 adults comfortably for our whole stay. Remember to ask for sheets for the pullout sofa if you are going to use it as they were not in the room. We also only had 1 clothes hanger. The staff was easy to deal with but had lost my paperwork so there was a little wait at check-in. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual!”
Reviews.Author: luvsthebeach_13
Reviews.Content: Third year staying here and still love it! Close enough to the beach yet private. Everyone here is so nice. Can't go wrong staying at the Spinnaker, wouldn't stay anywhere else! Pool is always clean and well maintained. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Ben K
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Spinnaker was great. The room was very clean, had comfy beds, and had a very nice size TV with many channels. Having the kitchenette was very convenient. Staff was friendly and helpful. The location near the not-so-busy part of the boardwalk was perfect. Could not have asked for anything else for our stay there! We will be back to the Spinnaker!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!! Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Amber P
Reviews.Content: We had 2 adults, a 16y/o and a 10y/o in our party. We arrived before check in and was allowed to use the pool until our room was ready. When we got to our room, we were surprised to see how nice and spacious it was! The friendly front desk staff had told us if anyone was planning on sleeping on the pull out sofa and needed another mattress for it to let them know. We did in fact take them up on that offer and it was comfy!! We had room 513 and it was very clean and well kept! The private balcony had 2 chairs and a table. We put our stuff in the fridge and after awhile noticed that only the freezer was working. I called the front desk and they sent a very nice guy up within just minutes! The fridge was indeed broke:( Within 5 minutes we had a brand new fridge ready to go!! He even mopped the floor before he left!! I wish I asked his name. The beds were comfy, bathroom was nice size with alot of sink room to unpack (face wash, perfume, lotion, etc), free wifi that we didn't have any problems using or gettin kicked off of!! Our housekeeper was Ms. Pat...oh what to say about Ms. Pat?? She did a wonderful job!! Thanks again Ms. Pat!! We miss seeing your bright smile every morning!! The ENTIRE STAFF was as friendly as friendly can be!! Thank you Spinnaker staff for making our stay soo wonderful!! I can honestly say, Spinnaker is the place to stay!! FRIENDLY, CLEAN, and NICE location!! Oh a one more thing, they have rolling carts to get your luggage to and from your car!!! VERY USEFUL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: Ben H
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here the 29th and 30th of July. We had only planned on staying one night and when we decided to stay a second, the staff was very accomodating and even worked with us to keep us in the same room despite the fact that our room was typically one of the first to go (Right on the corner w/ the best oceanview) The room was very clean, and well kept. No cigarette burns or ratty looking upholstery. The beach and boardwalk were less than a football field away which is very convient to everything. All in all, a very excellent choice for a weekend get away

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gino5044
Reviews.Content: The Spinnaker is on a great location on the Boardwalk, close enough to the action to walk but far enough away to feel crowded. The beach is a short walk, maybe half block and the water is close to the boardwalk. This part of the beach never seemed real crowded and you are right at a life guard chair. I will admit it,I am a hotel snob. I dislike outdoor walkways and want luxury and the thought of a "MOTEL" gave me the creeps. But I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable I am at the Spinnaker. The rooms are large and fit a family of 4 or 5 well. The beds were pretty good and never had a bad night sleep. It has a full sized kitchen and a nice sized bathroom. The sleeping area is a good distance from the door so you never felt like there are out door corridors. Whenever we needed extra towels or anything service was always quick and pleasant. Our youngest Daughter used the pull out couch and a good tip is that they will give you a second mattress upon request - get it. it was better than the regular beds! This was our second trip to the Spinnaker and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TrippyUSA
Reviews.Content: The Spinnaker Motel is at 18th Street and the Ocean City boardwalk - right at the beach and a bit out of the hubbub of downtown Ocean City. Our room was spacious for 5 people and loved having a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, walk to beach, would go back”
Reviews.Author: Allan S
Reviews.Content: While not fancy, this motel was among the very cleanest I've ever stayed at, thanks to Alice in housekeeping. Requests were addressed pleasantly and fast. Be aware that the voucher for free breakfast at Malia's Cafe (included with some rooms) only covers a separate menu from the one they have in your room. We didn't use the voucher, but did have a very good lunch at Malia's, outside since we were sandy from the beach. Outdoor pool was very clean. We were allowed to remain parked in their lot after check-out until mid-afternoon to keep taking advantage of the pool and beach until it was time to drive home.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, close to beach”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 of my children for one night in early May. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room itself was average, not new or impressive but decent enough for one night. This location is close to the beach, easy for walking on the boardwalk or if you want to spend the day at the beach. I wouldn't want to spend a lot of time in the room itself but if you just want a place to crash at the end of the day, it will do the job. Very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: redfireflies
Reviews.Content: 1st timer at the Spinnaker. Front Staff very pleasant. Rooms clean, nice view of the ocean. Sending a thank you to Tee for keeping our room tidy everyday. The beds were comfortable but short. Probably need to look into providing mattress toppers for the pull outs though, they're uncomfortable. For the most part it was quiet, there is a night club one block over and on Monday night the bass was probably not at the level it should of been or it wouldn't have kept my family of 5 up for an hour and a half. Toilet clogged twice and had to call for service they were prompt. The walls of the rooms are very sound proof, you don't even hear people closing their doors but the windows are a different story. The pool is an okay size wish it was a little bigger because it can get crowded. Overall I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but just right for an O.C. getaway!”
Reviews.Author: SPanky147
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a one night getaway after reading the other reviews. The Spinnaker was great! Not real fancy like the Holiday Inn next store, but almost half the price. You can tell this is not a big chain hotel. The folks at the front desk were super friendly. We arrived a bit early, so they pre-registered us so we could park (free) on the lot and enjoy the beach. The room was basic but clean with an efficiency kitchen and comfortable beds. Even though the hotel is not Ocean Front, we still had a great view of the ocean from the balcony. The location couldn't have been better. About 100 feet to the boardwalk at 18th street. Far enough up from the lower boardwalk that it was quiet, but not to far to walk to the action. The reservation came with 2 vouchers. We chose 2 restaurants and the vouchers worked just like cash with no "catch". To top it all off, we printed the Free Breakfast coupon from Trip Advisor, and enjoyed a real order-from-the-menu breakfast on the patio with a view of the beach! Much better than the usual Holiday Inn Express style breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “reviews accurate”
Reviews.Author: brendan1470
Reviews.Content: The Spinnaker Motel lived up to its excellent Tripadvisor reviews. We stayed in an ocean front efficiency that was immaculate. The motel is a 1/2 block from the beach which makes it very convenient. A restaurant Malias is attached. The food there is very good. The staff can't do enough for you. All and all it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION/FRIENDLY STAFF/AWESOME VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Mellymel3918
Reviews.Content: I booked an Oceanview Efficiency Plus(with breakfast for 2) on the web at the beginning of April for 2 nights-May 29th and May 30th based on the awesome reviews on Trip Advisor. The total price for the 3 of us was $305.96 which included tax and $1.50 per day safe fee. You also have that option when booking on the web to choose and receive free vouchers-how many is depending on the number of nights that you stay(we could choose 4). This may sound too good to be true but it is for real. Some vouchers allow for $15.00 or more off on a meal. I chose one for BJ's on the Water for $15.00 off which was absolutely free.There are vouchers offered for food as well as other services and attraction. Some are free of charge while others are offered at a reduced rate. I received a call at the end of April from Anita as I had not specified whether I wanted a smoking or non smoking room. Anita was so kind,helpful,and accomodating. I indicated on my web reservation that I would like to be in a room as close to the ocean as possible. I was aware that the motel was not ocean front as there is another building in front of it. Anita advised me that she put us in a room as close to the ocean as possible and that she thought that we would be very pleased. This was a very special trip for us as I indicated on the reservation that my husband was diagnosed with and had successful surgery and chemo for Pancreatic Cancer last June and was now cancer free. I felt like I was talking to an old friend when I spoke to Anita on the phone. We arrived at the motel on the 29th and were promptly checked in by a very helpful young lady named Sade' even though it was not even check in time yet. We were given room 510 which is on the south side of the building with rooms recently redecorated with new carpet,flat screen tv's etc. What can I say-Room 510 was awesome-it was on the top floor with a private balcony as close and as fantastic of a view of the ocean without it being ocean front. The view was fantastic and unobstructed.The balcony was private with a partition dividing it from the next balcony. We previously stayed in the Holiday Inn and Suites next door with a southern view using Priority Club points but the view was not near as clear or as awesome as the Spinnaker.I am very picky and found the entire room including the bathroom to be super clean and nicely furnished including new carpet and a flat screen tv. There was also a nicely furnished kitchen.We were told that they are also in the process of refurbishing the north building also. They have a nice outdoor heated pool. Our reservation included breakfast for 2 (2 vouchers equaling $16.00) at their on site cafe(open for breakfast and luch only). You were only able to order from a limited menu but it was still a great value for the price. The only suggestion I would make is to be able to use up to $16.00 if you would like to order from their regular menu but I have no complaints otherwise. Our room was very quiet. We did have a slight problem with the card key as it was a little quirky. I did get to meet Anita at checkout and she was just as pleasant in person as on the phone. Thanks Anita for putting us in an awesome room which made it extra special and to Sade' for your great service checking us in and out. We will definately be back. If you want a super clean room at a great price with super helpful staff then you can't go wrong staying at the Spinnaker-you will not be disappointed.Can'y wait to go back and for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Carib210
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 1/2 block off ocean & boardwalk. For being almost oceanfront, the price was great. It's an older hotel, other than the tv, don't think much was updated in recent years. Had fully equipped kitchen, clean and no frills or extras. It seemed empty when we were there and we had a room closest to the ocean, which was a really nice view. Pool seemed nice, but much too cool when we were there to try. Would recommend this hotel, can't beat their prices considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to be there again!”
Reviews.Author: Yelizaveta
Reviews.Content: Exsellent place to stay in low budget.Maintanence 24 hours,cleaning up every day,frendly staff,If you have extra bucks to be in Holiday Inn,they are next door.Spinnaker is for hard working family who are counting every penny.We enjoy our stay and will be back next spring!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the shore”
Reviews.Author: hoopscoach-dmar
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Wednesday in late May. Since it was midweek and before the busy season, we had no trouble getting a room. We requested a non-smoking room. The last “non-smoking” room we stayed in had a smell of stale smoke (Comfort Inn, Indiana, Pa), so we wanted to make sure the room was up to our standards. We asked about the room. A staff member gave us a key and told us to check out the room. Fortunately, there was no smell of smoke in our room. Our room was an efficiency and was very clean. The room had two double beds. The mattresses were firm and there were plenty of pillows. Included with the room was a flat-screen TV. There was a pullout sofa and a table with four chairs. There was a walkout balcony. There were two plastic chairs on the balcony, which had a view of the ocean. There was a stove, a microwave, a 10-cup coffeemaker and a nice-sized refrigerator. Cabinets with silverware and plates were included. The bathroom was decent-sized with a nice mirror. The water pressure on the shower was adequate. The only complaint that I had was the key card for the room. I have used key cards many times, but for some reason the key for our room was very sensitive. With a little patience, I finally was able to unlock the door after three or four "swipes." Although we did not get to use it, there is a nice pool and plenty of seating by the pool. There are tables with umbrellas. The room was $75 plus tax and included a free breakfast. The rate went up June 1st. Rooms at the beach are not cheap, but the Spinnaker provides nice rooms at reasonable prices. There was a nice café on the ground floor (Malia's) with inside or outside seating. The food was good and for us and reasonably priced (free!). We will return to the Spinnaker, probably during the off-season, when the rates are lower.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kristy3518
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spinnaker Motel over Memorial Day weekend for a last minute road trip. We were able to book our room Wednesday for a Friday arrival. We arrived before our check in time, but the front desk staff allowed us to settle our balance and get everything ready for when our room was cleaned. The front desk called me on my cell phone to let me know the room was ready, which was nice. They were very friendly at the front desk. The room was great. The most important thing…it was super clean! The maids do a heck of a job! Pretty much everything looked new in the room. Beds were comfy, sheets were clean, carpet was also clean. The room came equipped with a small kitchen and a balcony. The kitchen was a nice touch. We could see the ocean and boardwalk when standing on the balcony. The actual boardwalk and beach are literally steps away from the motel. Once we pulled in on Friday morning we didn’t have to drive anywhere, everything is in walking distance. The motel also has a small café (Malias). We enjoyed breakfast there, food was very good and so was the sun tea! The room was cleaned each day and the maids were super nice. The pool area was fun. There is a small pool and a deck with lounge chairs and tables. My only complaint is the elevator…it was a very uneasy ride up and down. Tried the steps, but they smelled like urine so we stuck with the elevator on most occasions! Overall, I would highly recommend the Spinnaker I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Right behind boardwalk, big/clean rooms, brand new flat screens. Best hotel I have stayed in yet in OC!”
Reviews.Author: WOLVES911
Reviews.Content: The spinnaker was worth the price for its distance to the boardwalk! It was yards away from the boardwalk, not right at the boardwalk but behind the hotel which did sit on the boardwalk. The balcony is great and we are definitely coming back and asking for a room on the end so we can have the ocean view which is no extra charge! All rooms are one size and include two beds, very spacious room with a very nice divider in case you have someone sleep on the pull out sofa which was very nice and a good size! (I never actually pulled out the sofa bed however.) The key card was the worst thing about this stay, there were times when it took five minutes of frustration to finally get the scan to register and unlock the door to our room! We did not get room service while we were here! The maid asked if we needed anything and gave us what we asked but our bed was never made or anything of the sort which you grow to expect. The bath water turns hot almost immediately, however it has a strong, strong bleach odor! There is a nice sized dinner table in the rooms, nice big, big windows facing the balcony. Nice lamp by the bed that includes two outlets so you can charge your cell phones conveniently. A small safe which they charge 4.50 for a week or something like that for. Carpet was very nice and almost bouncy!(thick) Very nice big mirrors, more tables, a kitchen, silverware, stove, everything. No ice machine, $3 ice bags at the cafe downstairs. Although the slight view has only further motivated us to look for an affordable hotel that actually sits on the boardwalk, we will remember how satisfying this spinnaker motel was, did not break the bank for being so nice and such a great location. Nothing great about maids or front desk staff, weren't off putting and that's enough for me. * If the next room we stay in has the same key card issue it will be enough to not return!

Reviews.Title: “Off season trip”
Reviews.Author: Lynda M
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, well maintained, reasonably priced motel in a great location. You will not be directly on the beach but many rooms have a ocean view. The only minor complaint I have is that they do not provide any amenities, even if you ask for them. I wanted coffee and since they have a coffee maker I assumed they would provide coffee and condiments. They do not. I asked at the front desk and the night manager and attendant acted as if I had been the 1st person to ever ask for such a thing. After being sent to a closed Dunkin-Doughnuts and the local CVS, I came back several times to see if they could get me coffee from one of the studio rooms that do provide coffee. The whole exchange seemed odd and lacking in customer service. Also we ran out of toilet paper after the 1st day and the maid service never replaced it. I guess they keep prices down by saving on the small things. All and all it was a pleasant stay and cleanliness and location would bring me back. Next time I will make sure to pack my coffee and t-paper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kameron12
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Spinnaker Motel. The rooms were very clean, quiet, and had a nice full kitchen which was great. Bathroom was clean and bright. Beds were very comfy, also had a pull-out sofa. View of ocean was great (was in a 3rd floor room) and only a few steps away from beach. The staff were very nice, friendly, and helpful! Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tonite33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 4/8 - 4/11. Our stay was very very nice. Anita and Sade were very helpful and have excellent customer service skills. We are a family of 4 and we checked in about 11:30pm. The pull out couch had a thin mattress, so I called the front desk and asked if we could get an extra mattress. Greg, who came on at 12am, was so helpful and friendly. He found us another mattress so we could add it onto the one that was there. Sade gave us a list of things that we could do around the motel that would be fun. The room was clean and the maid service was excellent. We were a few feet away from the boardwalk and we had a very nice, clear view of the beach. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: hmstetley
Reviews.Content: Our stay was beyond our expectations, the staff , the cleanliness, the set-up of the room were all fantastic. I can't recall staying at a motel where the staff was so friendly and accomodating. we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 435MF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer, and were very pleased. Centrally located, good onsite parking. We are a family of four, two adult and two teens. Plenty of room for all of us. Two double beds plus a sofabed, table and four chairs, kitchenette. Room came with a good sized balcony with a side view of the beach, boardwalk and ocean. Hotel is steps away from a not crowded area of the beach. Only complaints, ask for a room on an uppermost floor, so as not to be close to street traffic - though it does make for interesting people watching. Overall, nothing negative to say about this hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary (since Aruba was unfortunately out of the question). We were greeted by extremely friendly staff. We gained much information regarding the Winefest being held at the inlet. Our room was neat and clean. The kitchenette was a nice touch. The pool was a blast - we basically had it to ourselves. All in all, though not Bermuda, an excellent place to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: mwildshadow
Reviews.Content: Very Clean. Wonderful staff, very helpful. We all had a great time, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Alright but not a Great Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: Virginiafamily
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am not sure why the Spinnaker is ranked so highly on TripAdviser. I usually stay at the higher end hotels such as the Hyatt and the Hilton but shelling out the $200 plus dollars for the off season did not make sense to me so based on the review and the price, I decided to take a chance. This is not a bad hotel. It is clean but there is a hotel in front of it and the balconies are angled sideways so you have to really stick your body over the balcony to see the ocean. The smoking rooms get a little closer to the ocean. I dont understand why hotels like the Stowaway Grand arent ranked higher on here. They have good ratings, they are ocean front, on the boardwalk and affordable. That was my view from the Spinnaker so I couldnt understand why that one wasnt ranked before Spinnaker. I also inquired about the price which was equivalent to what I paid at Spinnaker. There are a dozen or more hotels that FACE the ocean and have the same affordable prices. These rankings are deceiving. Again, not bad for a moderate hotel but I need to see the ocean when I'm at the ocean! If I'm going to pay decent money, I want a great view of the ocean and there are better choices out there. Dont go by the rankings on here...although, if you have the money, you cant go wrong with the Holiday Inn Suites just a couple blocks down.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and close to the beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Leanna R
Reviews.Content: Was VERY impressed. This was our first beach vacation as a family (my first visit to OC) and I can't believe how close we were to everything, we never got in the car during our stay, any how clean the room looked AND smelled! And the price was great. I didn't see one creepy crawly the entire stay. Plenty of parking space, everything in the room worked, I really can't praise this place enough. It well exceeded my expectations. We had breakfast in the cafe there and the food was great, the whole family cleaned their plates!

Reviews.Title: “First Spin With Spinnaker”
Reviews.Author: Don K
Reviews.Content: We have been to OC numerous times over the past 20 years. But we have never found a motel that created an atmosphere that urged us to return. Our first spin at the Spinaker was an awesome change and a great decision. We chose Spinnaker based on the #2 rating of Tripadvisor. I thoroughly read all reviews and we decided to make our reservations. Check-in was quick and easy, the office staff as well as contacts with the housekeeping staff all provided a warm and friendly atmosphere. We were provided with a lovely fourth floor apartment "with a view". What an experience to wake up in the middle of the night and hear the waves breaking on the beach less than half a block away. We were close enough to local restaurants, boardwalk etc. that we could very well have not driven anywhere. The on property restaurant/coffee shop is great for breakfast and lunch. Read every other positive review about Spinnaker and you have an overall picture of the experience. We are already planning a return trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN ROOM”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: For the low cost of the motel, I was VERY impressed by the how clean and quiet our room was. The beds were very comfortable and there was plenty of hot water for baths and showers. The staff was very helpful when we asked for advice on seafood and pizza places, and they were right. Only one of the two elevators was working, but there was someone trying to fix the broken one. And hey, we were on vacation so the extra wait didn't matter.The location put us on the quiet end of the boardwalk and while not oceanfront, we had a great view of the ocean from our balcony, and the motel was mere feet from the beach We have stayed at more expensive places at OC, but this was by far the best experience we have ever had. We came home happy and relaxed. We're looking forward to going back next year and I will recommend the Spinnaker to friends and coworkers. I

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SLGrasley
Reviews.Content: We were on a Martz Bus Tour and the Spinnaker is where we stayed for our 5 day vacation. Motel was good, pool was good, location was good, staff was very helpful and friendly; not really fancy, but it was clean and had all the necessities for a terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: luvsthebeach_13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day weekend, our second time here. Check in quick and easy, the rooms are very clean and the maid service is great. Great view of the beach even though not oceanfront. Pool was always clean and the deck is great. My daughter and I had lunch there that we got from the hotel's cafe. Had a great breakfast there as well, very nice staff! As for the WiFi don't know...ON VACATION!!! Whatever did people do without it?

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bedford123
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time at the Spinnaker, The hotel is not oceanfront but it is only a few steps from the beach. It is on 18th street about half way down the boardwalk which makes the downtown activities very accessible without the noise , confusion & congestion of the downtown. All rooms are efficiencies with complete (although small) kitchens. They will sleep up to 6 people but that would be pretty crowded. they have 2 full size beds (not queen) & a small sleeper sofa. The bathroom is small. The hotel is very clean & employees friendly. Parking is close & adequate. The only negatives: tiny bars of soap, weak wifi & small beds. All rooms have balconies with ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: momSWOntario
Reviews.Content: Reasonably clean. Not sparkling, as prior reviews suggest, however better than average. Comfortable size rooms and kitchenette. Full size fridge was welcome for our family of 4. Tiny microwave. Note that the maid service does not include doing dishes and there is no dishwasher. Dishes are melamine, drinking glasses are real glass. Poor quality towels, but no problem getting as many as needed. No shampoo / conditioner - no issue for me, but a tip for others. Pleasant and helpfull staff. Good side view from room 208. Worst WiFi ever experienced, but we were successfully connecting to the free WiFI from Holiday Inn next door. Althought only $1/day, there is additional fee for safety deposit box regardless if you use it (although you should!!!). Nice location on boardwalk. Paid $170/night+tax on Labour Day weekend via www.ocmotels.com Reno the aged bathrooms and I would stay again. I prefer the Hilton up the street - better cleanliness, dishwasher, ceramic dishes, big suite, but of course big price:(

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: pougee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spinnaker for 4 days and it was great. I was a little nervous when we pulled in the hotel looked really out dated but i thought for the price that is what you get. Check in was a breeze, they gave you a parking tag and there was plenty of parking. i only mention the parking because the holiday inn (which is right next door) had ZERO parking. Guest were coming in and there where NO open spots the whole time we were there. People were parking on the street and in there overflow lot which was across the street. But back to the Spinnaker, the room was nice enough, the bathroom was ok there was always very hot water, there was a nice refridge, oven and everything you need. Housekeeping was nice the pool was COLD but then the put the heater on and it was perfect. All in all we would def.stay again. A little side note, if you like hot roast beef sandwiches you have to go to Anthony's on the corner of 17th street (a nice short walk with the family). They have the BEST roastbeef and Milkshakes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: skarekat
Reviews.Content: Purpose: Quick family getaway for a night We booked this hotel on Saturday (9/3/11) for Sunday (9/4/11) night. We got a decent rate of $199 (221 with tax) for an efficiency. Location: Very convenient from everything This hotel is very conveniently located, just one building away from the beach. There's a Dunkin Donuts right across the street, and also a restaurant in the same building which we didn't try. The main boardwalk is about a 15-20 minute walk, but you can always take the Boardwalk Tram ($20 for a roundtrip for a family of 4, not bad). We drove to the Assateague Island which is not too far from the motel. Food: There are good restaurants all around We did dinner at Da Vinci by the Sea, near 15th street. The food was good, and their house wine (I tried the Cabernet) was even better. I got breakfast from Dunkin Donuts right across the street. Amenities: They have clean rooms and a heated pool Though we didn't try the pool we did see a lot of people make good use of it. The rooms are spacious and clean. Our efficiency came with two double beds and an extra sleeper sofa. There was also a small kitchenette with all essentials like plates, spoons, forks, bowls, etc. The bathroom was little tight, but had really hot water running all the time. They don't provide shampoo so remember to carry your own. The main reason I'm giving this 4-stars is because it doesn't have a coin operated laundry. The closest one is on 7th or 8th street. This motel is on 18th street. Parking is convenient, right next to the motel and is free, limited to one car per room, and you get a tag when you check in. There is a balcony, ours overlooked the side street and also gave us a view of the beach. The balcony has two vinyl chairs that are useful for sitting or even hanging clothes to dry. :-) There is a 27" flat screen Samsung TV that the kids enjoyed. There's a breakfast table and 4 chairs that was handy when I got breakfast from Dunkin Donuts. There's a safe in the room that we didn't use. Overall: Great value and convenient location I would recommend this motel to anyone seeking a quick weekend beach getaway. This might be a little too cramped for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great and affordable”
Reviews.Author: graduate105
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is not fancy but it is perfect for a family on a budget. Within walking distance to the boardwalk. It was close without being directly on the boardwalk and it was quiet. 6 of us were in the room and we very comfortable. Sofabed is horrible so you might want to bring a blow up mattress. People in the office were amazing!! They made the check in/out process extremely easy and painless. ***TIP** DO NOT depend on the free wifi if you must use the internet on your trip. It was horrible but what do you expect for free. LOL. Room comes with a full kitchen (stove, oven, fridge, microwave, toaster and coffee pot), dishes and pots. This came in handy because food can be expensive on vacation with a large group so cook your breakfast and lunch and splurge on dinner. I will be back to this hotel. **Another TIP** Only one elevator and that can be annoying but not that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: factlaw
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of other OC hotels in the past, I like this one best. Location is excellent, and it is kind of nice being bookended by hotels for which rooms cost double (and more). This place was clean, and as advertised. The only negative was the very spotty and slow wi-fi, as pointed out by other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: dimplex99
Reviews.Content: I'm not a hotel snob, so this place was very comfortable and pleasant for me. We stayed for 2 nights and I have an infant with me, so the kitchen was super convenient to have. The kitchen is small, but nice to have overall if you want a quick-fix to eat indoors. The beds were not very big, I would say full-size, not really queen. They were not comfortable either, however the room was large for at least 4 people to stay in. Overall, I give it high marks for being CLEAN, which is the main concern when I stay anywhere. Rooms were ocean-view, and the boardwalk is only a few feet away, and in walking distance. I liked how it wasn't too close to the boardwalk, to where it could get noisy at night, but just the right distance from it. Bathrooms were small, but clean, and yes the water pressure was low, and that's about the only complaint I have about the rooms. Front-desk staff was friendly, but I cannot say the same for the maids. I witnessed one the maids making a slight remark when she was told to clean the rooms. She said, something snotty on the lines of she'll clean them when she gets to them, check-in isn't until 4pm anyway. I thought it was pretty rude to make that remark in front of guests, especially when I had an infant and I was waiting to be checked-in! That is why I give it 4 stars, instead of 5! I highly recommend the cafe downstairs. Forget about the free wifi. It wouldn't pick up signal on the 4th floor. Reasonably-priced, staff was friendly, and the food was good. My family would definitively stay here again in our next visit to OC!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Berniece_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a couple days at the beach. Kitchen fully equipted so you can eat in if you want or boardwalk eateries available.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's made out to be...”
Reviews.Author: laurip13
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 2 nights last week. It was a last minute vacation so we were limited in our hotel selections. Because this motel was rated #3 out of all the OC hotels, I was comfortable booking it. Let me also say that we have stayed at the #2 (the Hilton). WHAT A HUGE DIFFERENCE!! I know the price is a huge difference, but I cannot believe their ratings are so close! It makes me wonder if there are some bogus ratings on here?? Anyway, as soon as we got to our room, I began to check the beds for bedbugs. Thankfully, their were no signs. But, when I opened the sofabed, there was a silverfish crawling on the mattress. Just 1 that we found. I called the front desk, I was told someone would come right up and check. Well, a maintenance man did come up, but never made it through the doorway. Once I told him my husband killed it he left. So, we did not use the sofabed for our stay. This made our stay uncomfortable. There were two double beds and 5 people. The location is good. The bathroom is tiny. Only big enough for one person...if you shut the door. It was clean though. The balcony door did not latch properly. It seemed as though they had rigged it so we could atleast lock it, but it would not shut completely. Would not stay here again! The extra money spent to stay at another hotel would be worth it. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: myvegasISshowing
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just returned from a 3 night stay at the Spinnaker. The hotel is located on 18th street, so you are close to boardwalk and everything it has to offer. For three nights the cost was around $730 with taxes and fees, not too bad considering OC prices and the location. The room itself was very clean and nice. We did not use the kitchen except for the fridge, which was nice to keep water, milk , and juices cold for when needed. Also we took ice packs to freeze so we could take cold drinks to beach with us in cooler. The only problem with the room is the double beds . Personally I would like to have had 2 queen beds, especially since they have the room to do it. Just not enough room for 2 people to sleep comfortably. Also the mattress were a little used and hard to sleep on. But we made do and really enjoyed every other aspect of the room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MODIAM
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and setup nicely for a short or extended stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location. Like that they provide 4, rather than the standard 3 towels as a beach vacation requires two daily showers. Only issue is the towels are really low grade. Would expect more when paying almost $250 a night. We ate out, but accommodations have a small kitchen a nice eating area if you want to cook. Overall a pleasant stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise”
Reviews.Author: Monica H
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Ocean City for a 4 days weekend, we could accomodate 4 adults and 2 children (2 @ 11) . The rooms were clean and although is a "older" style hotel it couldn't have a better location on the walkboard (right next to Holiday Inn) . Service is very respectful and complete. The only tiny problem was that we went in 2 cars and they only allow you one in the parking lot still even when you park outside it is not that far neither. I gladly can come back to this hotel..prices are excellent especially when you can accomodate so many people in one room.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: cbscribe
Reviews.Content: The location was very good and the hotel room, clean and spacious. Only complaints would be low water pressure in the shower and ... most frustrating ... inability to access the Internet unless we were actually in the hotel office. My husband was teaching an online course at the time and had hoped to be able to check in periodically on his students' work. No such luck. But if you don't need Internet service, that shouldn't be much of a drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great Second Choice - Stayed 2x's this summer!”
Reviews.Author: Kmywalker3
Reviews.Content: My familly of four (my husband and I, my daughter who's 2 1/2, and my son 3 months) loved staying at this hotel this summer... in fact, we loved it so much, we stayed twice! The hotel was quiet, roomy, and CLEAN! My daughter proudly announced the first time we stayed that the "room is beautiful!". I enjoyed feeding my son on the balcony while looking at the ocean. A wonderful perk is its location to the boardwalk and beach. We were nervous about making this trip with a 3 month old, but this hotel, including its staff and ammenities made it very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: igolfCA
Reviews.Content: The Spinnaker was recommended to us by friends who live in MD and had stayed there. We were happy with our decision to try it. Ocean City is expensive, and many of the best hotels there cost more than the equivalent hotels in Hawaii that I have been to. So even though I thought at first that the hotel was not worth what it cost, it is worth it compared to other hotels in the area. Hotel was clean, and the location was fantastic. It was just off the boardwalk within walking distance to everything. The pool was nice with a large gated deck for eating to one side. The rooms were large with balconies that had a view of the ocean (not oceanfront). We had a small kitchen with the basics (coffee pot, microwave, toaster), plus an assortment of dishes, glassware, pots, etc. There was also a refrigerator, small stove and oven. The hotel has a restaurant downstairs which we tried once for breakfast with no complaints. Staff was very nice and friendly. Our only complaint was that internet service was provided, but we were never able to access it the 4 days that we were there. The connection was showing as very low. and nothing would come up. So if computer usage is important, better try to log on somewhere else. Overall, it is a basic hotel but provides a comfortable stay with the high prices found at Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: ridetheseal
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Spinnaker for 4 nights last week. We were very pleased with the motel. The best thing is the location. Located just a half block away from the beach and boardwalk on 18th street, it is close enough to the action but far away from the busiest/noisiest sections of the boardwalk. It is the perfect location. I wouldn't want to stay any further north. The shops/food pretty much start on 16/17th street. The rooms are great. They are large w/2 double beds and a pullout couch. We didn't have a need to pull the couch out so I can't comment on that but to sit on it was very uncomfortable. That didn't bother us though. as we just used it to throw clothes. We pushed the beds together and it became a King and a half. The room had a 27 inch flat screen tv w/all the cable channels you'd want plus HBO. The best feature is the kitchenette. It has a full size fridge, stove, coffee maker, microwave and sink. The fridge was great because we had a lot of leftover food that we could store and also refreeze our cooler icepacks. We ate dinner out 2 nights and had leftovers for 2 nights. it was terffific. We were in a corner room in the South Bldg. If you stay try to get the corner room in the South Bldg. The room #'s are 510, 410 and even 310 should be fine. We were in 410 and because we were the corner, had no balcony to the left of us, just a picture perfect view of the beach and ocean. The North Bldg is on the Bay side, so the views won't be as good. If you can't get a corner room in the South Bldg just try to get 1 next to it if possible. The closer to the corner, the better the views. They have a pool and deck which looked fine but we didn't use because we were there for the beach. They also have a cafe downstairs, Malia's. We ate there for breakfast once and it was good. My only complaint with the motel are the elevators. They only have 2 per building which would be enough if they were bigger and faster but they're old and slow. My wife felt a little claustrophobic in them. Not enough of an issue for me to knock off a star though but they should improve them. The rooms were spotless. I didn't see one bug in the room the entire time. The A/C was amazing and quiet. There were 2 A/C settings, low cool and high cool. I had it on low cool the entire time and it was fine. And I'm the type who needs serious A/C. The A/C was phenomonal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: TMCS
Reviews.Content: This motel is right next door to the $500+/night Holiday Inn - where my brother was staying. The beds & sheets were soft & comfortable. The air conditioner was a little noisy but kept the room nice & cool. The room was quiet & roomy enough. The kitchenette was clean, with a pretty large refrigerator. Location was great & the restaurant was good. The staff at the front desk were very friendly & helpful. Probably my only complaint would be the horrible sleeper sofa - definitely in sorry shape - hard to sleep or sit on. We ended up pulling the mattress out & putting it on the floor. It wasn't the Ritz but it was an OK place to stay & we would most likely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: Nes1079
Reviews.Content: Just got back, had a great time. Staff was great, only con about the room was small bed's. Other then that room was great. Full kitchen and clean. Slow wifi connection. Lots of parking, good bang for your buck. I would go back, and refer to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience location”
Reviews.Author: meoluoiVa
Reviews.Content: Spinnaker got a new face of renovation. New wallpaper, new carpet, new furniture, etc...We always stay at Spinnaker every summer (2 trips/4 nights/year). In-room kitchens are equipped with oven, gas stove, microwave, and full set of cookware. If you prefer to save some $, just buy live crab, lobsters, & crab cakes, corn .... then steam them up!! Yummy!!!! Pros: nice swimming pool, great room, nice people. Cons: 1. very slow internet connection...... 2. It took around 30 secs to get warm water came out of shower head. "Made in China" cold/hot mixing valve??? No biggie! Watch out for the wheels/roller locks under your bed. My leg got a minor cut!

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy5061
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean and the staff couldn' t have been nicer. the rooms were large and we were able to see the ocean from our room even though it wasn't ocean front. loved the location close to everything but in a quieter part. the cafe was very good. the pool and deck kept clean though i wish they would keep it open later then 9:oopm.

Reviews.Title: “read before you book”
Reviews.Author: mrwhosreef
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the spinnaker motel for 4th of july weekend. The motel is not on the ocean and does not have much of an ocean view. The outside of the hotel is dirty looking including the pool. The motel does not have a bar by the pool. The rooms are not very up to date but are clean. On the good side if you have to stay here the cleaning service did a good jog on the rooms. The restaraunt has good food but sometime a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place; terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: toodlelu
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after a week at the Spinnaker. It was a great stay! I didn't know what to expect, as I've only seen the motel on my way out of the city. However, we were looking for a reasonable efficiency unit that was close to the boardwalk but away from the normal hubbub. The Spinnaker had it all . . . Clean room (thanks to Brenda), helpful staff (thanks, Anita), comfortable beds (even the sofa bed!) and not too far away from anything. We had a couple of things that needed mechanical attention after we checked into our room, but that was promptly taken care of. Although we were warned that the motel was in a "party block", we had no problem with noise. The best part was that when we checked out, I had left a couple of items in the room, and was notified within the hour of our departure that we had left the items. We made arrangements with UPS to have our items returned. Wi-Fi is available. The views were fantastic! We could see the ocea from our second floor balcony. We highly recommend that when you make your reservation, that you definitely take advantage of the breakfast vouchers at Malia's Cafe, located in the motel. Breakfast there was hot, and very good; a real highlight of the trip, since I can tell you we paid more $$ for lousy food on this time around . . . A great trip--and we will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Suuki
Reviews.Content: Spinnaker was a surprise. The room was clean. Staff were helpful. No frills but good location and decent room.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: KassieLynn3
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend absolutely love this hotel. We have been staying for a couple years now. Ive been there with friends too. I was down in May of this year and the rooms were remodeled. They were very nice. The hotel management is really nice. & the hotel is right by the water. I plan on staying here everytime I come to ocean city maryland. : )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price and personal were terrific.”
Reviews.Author: cadams60
Reviews.Content: Although a small check-in problem it was quickly resolved. The staff was terrific. Efficiency is laid out very well. Definitely one of the best places we have stayed for location and price. On site cafe is very handy and delicious food, I certainly would recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: I booked the Spinnaker on the advice from a friend who stays there often. I booked the motel about two months in advance for two nights, Thursday and Friday. I liked the location on the boardwalk, about in the middle of it in a quieter part of the boards. Closer to the time of our stay, they started a promotion where if you booked 2 nights, you'd get a third night free but does not include weekends. I called the hotel to ask about it, just in case I might be able to take take advantage of the promo. They immediately and graciously gave me Wednesday for free. In addition to that, they also gave me 4 discount vouchers from various restaurants and one for a t shirt from a local pub. I got to choose which ones I wanted, and used 2 of them during my stay. A total savings of $35 by using the two vouchers. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the nicest desk attendant. She was pleasant and upbeat and couldn't do enough for us. The Spinnaker sets back behind one building, but only steps to the boardwalk and beach, so I asked for the highest floor and best view available. Unfortunately, that room was being renovated, so they gave me the one next to it. We were delighted the moment we opened our door. Everything was fresh and clean, new carpeting and bedding and mattresses. Flat screen tv's, a full kitchen, and four comfy pillows on each bed. The view was very good and we could see both the ocean and the bay from our balcony. The ony negative I have to say was that the sofa bed in the room needed replacing..........not because it was dirty, but because it was worn.
