And there was no shampoo, but in this economy it's a small thing to sacrifice considering the great rate and deals we received in return. Oh, and they also have a very nice cafe on site and we also received a free breakfast for 2 at the cafe! Very bright and cheerful with a Carribbean decor. The food was very good........hot and tasty, and excellent service. I would reccommend this motel to families, senior citizens, and anyone who wants a clean, nice, reasonably priced place to stay in the heart of Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for Bike Week”
Reviews.Author: jerseymariner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I joined up with a group of about 5 couples who have spent several years staying at the Spinnaker for Delmarva Bike week. The hotel is a little worn, but the location is prime, the staff helpful, and the rooms clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Spinnaker!”
Reviews.Author: OC4me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending Sunfest weekend at the Spinnaker. This hotel consistently provides clean comfortable rooms at a fair price. The location is perfect for going to the beach or taking in the boardwalk attractions. Over the years, we have stayed at many of the hotels in Ocean City, ranging from the best to the worst. Unfortunately, it has gotten to the point where price is no indication of quality. In fact, some of the hotels in OC should have been shut down by the Health Dept years ago but yet they continue to operate AND charge exhorbitant rates for what is basically a dirty dump. We take several weekend trips to Ocean City during the year and The Spinnaker is always our first choice for accomodations. The rooms are spacious with full kitchen capacities and appliances. The equipment is clean and always in good working condition. The bathroom is a nice size and again, always kept sparkling clean. The beds, bed linens, and furniture are well taken care of and very comfortable. My favorite feature is the private balcony that provides a great view of the ocean even though the hotel is not technically oceanfront. Finally, the most overwhelming reason we choose the Spinnaker time and again is the wonderful staff who make you feel like family while you are staying there. They will do ANYTHING to make sure every guest is happy and well taken care of during their stay. Thanks to the office and the housekeeping staff for the hard work you do that makes this hotel our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmiller1156
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I was down there with my family and we had a great time and will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel”
Reviews.Author: Stormchaser1966
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Ocean City, and this time I decided to stay at the Spinnaker. I'd seen it during previous trips and thought it looked like a decent motel. After reading the reviews on the property, most of them seemed overwhelmingly positive. Now having been to the Spinnaker, I feel the reviews were quite accurate. The room was large, which is always a plus in my eyes. The efficiency kitchen was perfect for stocking food and beverages so that we didn't have to go to restaurants for some of our smaller meals. An even bigger plus for me was the cleanliness of the property -- the bedroom, the kitchen, and the bathroom were immaculate. But the top billing goes to the location of the place: right on the boardwalk, being walkable distance to just about anything. I also couldn't get over how friendly everyone was. The staff (in particular the front desk and housekeeping staff) made you feel like they knew you, even though they'd never met you in their lives. They know how to make someone feel like a genuine "guest". If I had anything negative to say, it would be a minimal comment about the poor water pressure on the 5th floor. That being said, it just required me to stand under the shower a bit longer to rinse off the soap. Not a biggie to me, although to others it might be a bit more of a problem. I'm already planning my next trip there, and I'll be sure to stay at the Spinnaker again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: citygirlBrooklyn_Ny
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a wonderful time while staying at this motel. At first I had my concerns about staying at a motel but those concerns quickly faded the minute we checked into the hotel. The motel had spacious accommodations with a private balcony and a side view of the ocean. We were just steps away from the ocean and boardwalk. The only thing negative thing I have to say is the wi -fi connection was slow and it kept freezing but no biggie. What a great idea to separate the pool area from the lounge area for those who wanted to just relax and not have to worry about being splashed by swimmers. We were so sad to leave but we had to go back to the real word. Thank you Sinnakers for an awesome time!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: 1ROSHEA1
Reviews.Content: The motel is conveniently located a block beach and boardwalk. Although it is quiet a walk to the pier where the rides are, that is nice because there is less noise and crowds where the motel is. The Spinnaker offers a small heated out door pool and a very nice sun deck. The rooms are clean, staff is accomodating and sweet, and the views are awesome. It was a little tight for two grown 12 year olds and a couple, but great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the Spinnaker for 8 nights(aug 13 to 21)”
Reviews.Author: pricey106
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Spinnaker. This year we took our grand parents. There was five of us in the room. A little cramped, but we made it comfortable. The staff helped out too. The maids were good at cleaning and maintanence didn't hesistate on any request. Here is my review list. - great location, right off the boardwalk on 18th street, the somewhat quiet area. -great view if you get the right room, closest to ocean, in the north side. - always had a parking spot. - decently clean pool ( a little expected sand ) and large pool deck that allows alcohlic drinks as long as they are not glass. - nice sized private balcony. -comfy and clean beds. The pull out bed was alright, better for kids. We let gram and pop have the one bed and my son to have the other. My wife and I had the pullout. We requested to have another mattress to double it up. They brought a brand new one!. - rooms need to be updated. Some of the carpet was not even right to the wall( like a 1 inch gap from wall) in certain areas. Some wallpaper separated from wall. -bathroom was alright. Clean and medium sized. Toilet was a little wobbly and exhaust fan underpowered. Water pressure was weak. - speaking of restrooms. They have a restroom right by the pool. Good luck on using it. The office told me they lock it after 3 because there is a leak! It maybe locked before that too!. Next year around reservation time I will be calling them to see if there have been any improvements made. If not we will not be staying there. 1400 dollars for 8 nights and 200 extra for 2 extra people.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Hollymomma3
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our recent stay at the Spinnaker. We asked to add a 4th night to our stay and Anita was able to make it happen for us without having to change rooms. We booked the 4th fl room closest to the beach so our view of the boardwalk and beach was great. Loved the full size refrig and coffee maker--both necessary for a family of 5. Double beds were very comfortable but sofabed mattress was worn. My 8 yr old was able to sleep on the couch w/out opening bed. Pool is heated and free internet is avail. No ice machine avail but was able to make ice in room freezer and use in small cooler. We were so close to the beach that we could run up to the room a few times to get whatever we needed...so convenient with young kids. Liked the fact that parking was there AT the motel, not in a lot across the highway. Room was tight for 5 of us, but managable for 4 nights with family. And the rates for mid August were reasonable, not outrageous. The only negatives I can think of are that our bathroom fan did not work (again, only family so dealt with it) and saw a few ants on kitchen counter the day of check out. Otherwise, we expected basic, and got pretty nice...so I would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not good either.”
Reviews.Author: tyryr4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Spinnaker Motel for a 4 night mini vacation with family. We had an ok stay. Pros- Rooms were nice, clean, and especially liked the room divider. Was close to boardwalk (1/4 block) and beach. Pool was very nice and clean. Had small efficiency kitchen which saved us money on food. Had a small cafe where we were able to get coffee and quick bites. On site showers to wash off from the beach. The cleaning crew was great. Cons- Was supposed to be in another room, lower level, sideview of ocean, instead got 5th floor, corner balcony by street. WIth a 3 year, was very scarey going out onto balcony, and NO view of ocean. Asked what happened to our original room, and was told it was given to someone else who also had small children and didn't like this room. Huh? No ice available. Elevator was a death trap, closed on my 3 year old. No water pressure in shower and kept getting cold. Overall, was an ok stay. HATED the elevator. Probably the biggest complaint about our stay other than the room mix up. FOr the cost, neither high nor low, I probably will not stay here again. FOund other hotels, nicer, cheaper, off of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location, clean rooms and value pricing”
Reviews.Author: travelbugs2318
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Spinnaker motel for four nights. This was my first visit. The office employees were very friendly and effiecient. When we made our reservations, we requested an ocean view room. We were very happy to find out that we did get an ocean view room. It was one of the rooms at the end of the building. The room was very clean and big enough for a family of four. The bathroom was a decent size and it was very clean and the shower had great water pressure. The maid service was great. She came every morning when we went to breakfast and did a great job of cleaning our room. The hotel also has enough parking so that each room gets one parking spot right near the hotel. You don't have to worry about overflow parking or finding a parking spot on the street. When we visit Ocean City next summer, we will definitely be staying at Spinnaker.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Motel in Ocean City, Maryland”
Reviews.Author: OCMDBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: The Spinnaker Motel has been serving Ocean City, Maryland's tourists since 1975. I feel it is the cleanest and best maintained/managed motel in Ocean City.... it sits in the perfect location in the town (18th Street and Oceanside), so you are close to all of Ocean City's restaurants and attractions... you can walk the boardwalk, take the boardwalk tram or take the Ocean City bus rather rapidly to all that Ocean City has to offer. It has a spacious, well lit and protected parking lot, so let the car sit!!!! All of the rooms are efficiencies and feature 2 double beds, a sofa with a pull out bed and a private balcony with great views of the beach, the ocean and the boardwalk. They have an elevated heated pool with a deck that spans between both buildings.... it's very nice. It is an exceptional place for families with young children..... The way the property is set up, it makes it easy to let the kids roam, while keeping an eye on them..... There is also a nice coffee shop at the Spinnaker that is open for breakfast and lunch.... they've got great food.... the rates are reasonable and affordable..... this is a place I highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait for next year!”
Reviews.Author: ziggy55
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at The Spinnaker last week and it was great! I am really picky and I can't find one thing negative to say. The view was great, just steps to the boardwalk, the beds were really comfortable and so were the pillows, the housekeeping was great (Alice), the room was big and the kitchen was more than adequate. The staff in the office were friendly and efficient. I asked for an extra chair for the balcony and it was there before I even hung up the phone. We didn't use the pool but it looked clean and there is a huge sundeck. Most of all, the place was CLEAN! We can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and prices, close to beach and boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: SoccerMom3boyz
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this hotel for many years. It's great for the family, nice rooms, full kitchen, great service, friendly staff, great balcony view! Being right at the beach with small children is a plus because you have so much to carry and you have their safety to worry about; not crossing major streets is convenient. It's also close to pizza shops, resaurants, CVS and more. It's also nice being right at the boardwalk for evening walks and morning bike rides. We will continue to come to the Spinnaker for our vacation as long as they are there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: 1257powell
Reviews.Content: I have been to Ocean City many times in my life but never stayed at the Spinnaker Hotel. I decided to give it a try. The hotel was one of the older ones but for the price that we paid it was worth it. I would not hesitate to stay there again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location was great and the hospitality at the hotel was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: andrewb92
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about a mile up the boardwalk from the southern tip. All the rooms have balconies with a partial view of the ocean as well as a very nice little kitchenettes. The staff was very friendly. Most importantly for me, the price was great for all that you got. I've payed much more in Ocean City for hotels that weren't half as nice.

Reviews.Title: “best room I ever had in ocean city”
Reviews.Author: dedew50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in alot of different motels in Ocean City. But until this time I have never stayed at the Spinnaker. The room was the cleanest I have ever seen. The service was great. From my room, I could see the ocean if I looked right and I could see the bay if I looked left. There was a full size refrigator and a apartment size stove, a micowave and toaster. There was also dishes and pans if you needed them. It is located right off the broadwalk. I can not say enough about this hotel. I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan9
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this is an older beach hotel that is no frills, but a really nice, clean place. We stayed down here for a long weekend in September. When we first checked in, we were put in a room on the first floor and it was near the street, so there was no oceanview. When I called and requested a move, the asst mgr immediately corrected the problem and put us in a different tower on a higher floor. The rooms were much larger than I expected and they came with kitchnettes that had a full sized refrigerator. The only thing that could be better is offering some king sized bed rooms for couples instead of the standard two double beds in every room. Otherwise, for the money, you get a nice, big clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own shampoo!”
Reviews.Author: swimmer4life8
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the shampoo and shower. First of all, the shower in our room worked well once we figured out that the hot and cold water was switched. It took my daughter several screams to figure it out. But before we could even take our shower, we had to walk to CVS to buy shampoo, which the hotel does not provide. When making your reservation, you should specify whether or not you want a smoking room. They didn't mention that they had both rooms, so they put us in a smoking room even though we wanted a non-smoking room. However, they did a good job sanitizing the room to the point where the smoke smell wasn't present. We were on the fourth floor, which had a good side view of the ocean, but be prepared to take the steps because the elevator, the one and only in the building, was ridiculously slow. The weekday price was suitable for the room, but their price for the weekends and holidays are higher than other hotels that offer better amenities. Finally, if you are hoping to bring the laptop along and connect to their wifi, forget it. Our connection would last a minute before disconnecting and requiring us to re-boot our computer. Overall, the Spinnaker wasn't bad for a weekday stay as long as you remember your shampoo and you don't need to connect to their wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel!”
Reviews.Author: hammertimehi
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this motel based on the reviews and the reviews were right. We stayed here with our 3 children ages 8, 5 and 1 and some friends with young children as well. The staff was so friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very large. A full size frig, stove, table with 4 chairs and a sofa with pull out bed. The balcony was really large as well with a decent side view of the beach/ocean. The pool was small but clean and good enough for the kids. The motel was so close to the beach. The rooms were a bit outdated but for the price, its was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: helen_precious
Reviews.Content: After trying to decide where to stay last week (July 25-Aug 1) we decided to stay at the Spinnaker Motel and I have to say we were not dissapointed.....we were very pleased. We decided to go with the Spinnaker based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor and due to the low price. My husband and two children (ages 8 and 4) were very happy. The motel is very clean. The room was an efficiency, with a full size refrigerator, utensils, oven, coffee maker. Great balcony with an ocean view. The pool was wonderful. My kids loved it. The motel is also in a great location, close to a CVS, liquor store, Dunkin Donuts. The motel also has a coffee shop downstairs. Good food, great prices. We really enjoyed our stay and would definetly recommend it to anyone wanting nice accomodations for a reasonable price. Also, for those of you who love seafood.....you can't miss Higgin's Crab House. The snow crab legs were out of this world! This will be my third time visiting Ocean City, MD. It's definetly one of my favorite places.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, and we loved it again!”
Reviews.Author: NeenerPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spinnaker for the second year in a row. Again, we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are very clean, the beds are comfortable, and the location is great! When anything goes wrong at this hotel, the problem is fixed right away. On our first day, I noticed that the lock on the door to the pool deck wasn't locking correctly. I didn't report it....it wasn't a big deal to me. But, the next morning, I noticed it was fixed already. One day there were some bugs in the pool and it seemed that the filter might not be working. We reported it to the front desk, and clean fresh water was pouring into the pool within minutes. Again, the next day there were no bugs at all in the pool. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it's BEST !”
Reviews.Author: iundrstnd2
Reviews.Content: Make your reservation NOW for a great vacation ! My daughter and I celebrated our birthdays with a week long vacation . This was an important vaction for us, the first we are taking together as Adults ( she just turned 20) , the first after a major loss in our family, and of course to celebrate our birthdays which are 5 days apart. The Spinnaker Hotel was a wonderful choice to make for our lodging needs. I have been in Senior Management in the Hotel Industry for the past 20 plus years working 4 star full service to Economy Brands, I have worked in both the Sales and Operations end of the business. My daughter has grown up in the industry via mom and can voice her displeasure quite well. I set the Bar High and so does she. So taking a chance on a hotel I had no idea about was going to be a true trust in the Management and Team of Associates I was about to meet. The Spinnaker Hotel on 18th and Baltimore exceeded my expectations in a Summer Resort Beach Hotel. Five Perfect reasons why: 1. Reservations made easy by using the OCMOTELS website, Somehow I overbooked and my call to the hotel when I recieved confirmation to cxl one reservation was met by Anita the Asst.Manager , I could hear her smile through the phone, made the changes I needed, took time to ask me what I needed while I woulod be with them, and my room when I arrived was EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED ! Thank you Anita. 2. Our arrival was expected, by the hotel, and the TEAM at the front desk, meeting Anita and Judy was a perfect start, the location was easy to get to and right at the beach and boardwalk. They told us about all we should see, the best places to eat , they took an interest in us, why we were visiting, who we were. WE BECAME PART OF THE FAMILY ! 3. Lugging all we had to the room ( remember 2 women) was made easy, they asked us if we needed help WOW ! Luggage carts , an elevator to 5th floor ,like a cool beach breeze! THe room was clean and well kept, it had all the requirements we needed and more ( well a 2nd bath would be nice) and enough space for all of our things and all we bought during the week. I could see a family of 4 being quite comfortable. OUr veiw from room --- (I am not telling or I will never get in it again :) was fantastic , perfect, wonderful. The beds were very comfortable, I slept like a log ( ask my daughter how well I snored). WE FELT AT HOME ! 4. I met the General Manager Heather and one of the Corporate Directors and and they asked me how my stay was, what were my suggestions to help them improve, they thanked me for choosing the SPINNAKER MOTEL, and again made suggestions on Ocean City activities. WE FELT WELCOMED! 5. We were enjoying ourselves so much we extended our stay, due to making this change on July 3rd they asked if we would mind switching rooms as the perfect view room was already booked, they would move us , I was just as pleased with room 2, a larger balcony and still a fantastic view of the Ocean , Beach and Boardwalk. The consistancy of the conditon and cleanliness was the same , no dissapointments with that. The pool was clean and refreshing , the sundeck inviting and colorful with flags, plants and GREAT LOUNGE AND PICINIC FURNITURE, the onsite resturant was like visiting a family member , the staff was welcoming the food good and the price right. The location was perfect, the housekeeping and maint teams were helpful and always smiling, our stay was GREAT. WE GOT VALUE! We will be back and we do want to say ...CHECK OUT the SPINNAKER Motel in Ocean City , MD

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value! I would definetly stay again!! Hopefully next year!”
Reviews.Author: Crispie94
Reviews.Content: I thought the Spinnaker was a GREAT value for our money. Hands down, regardless of any complaints the location is great and the rooms have all the ammenities you could possibly need and are very clean. Our room, which I would assume to be "standard" had a kitchenette including dishes, an almost full size fridge/freezer, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. The bedroom had two full size beds plus a pull out sofa-sleeper with and actual room divider in between. I loved the balcony the best! We traveled with kids so this was so relaxing in the evening. We were able to go out and have some PRIVACY from our kids!!! I realize the balconies aren't fully private as one other review had stated but they were more than private enough for us. They have partitions which start about 6 - 12" off the ground and go about 6 - 12" from the ceiling and all the way to the railing. I guess I wouldn't put anything out there that you'd be worried about getting stolen but with the hum of the a/c and the partitions it was awesome! Private conversation! I wished we had one at every stop on our travels! Others have also commented about the view being partial but I know from where we were we had a very nice view. I guess when you book this hotel you have to keep in mind it's not ocean front but for the value who cares! If you want to see the ocean up close walk down to the beach, it's literally 1/2 a block down! There were a few small things that happened while we were staying there... at one point I went in to take a shower and water was pouring in from upstairs onto my head. I found out in a quick hurry that our upstairs neighbor had overflowed his toilet. The hotel staff handled it very well. Fixed the problem and came and cleaned our bathroom with an apology. Although I could've done without the toilet water on my head they were very apologetic and really it wasn't their fault so I don't feel like they owed me anything but the apology was very nice and appreciated. My only other real complaint was that our last night their my now husband and I decided to get married. My cousin was kind enough to take our girls so we could have one night to ourselves. In the morning housekeeping was banging on our door and calling our room. I'm sure we stayed out later than we probably needed to but the staff knew we were getting married so I thought it was a bit much. Especially when my husband and I were running back and forth trying to load our van with 2 - 3 housekeeping staff standing directly outside our door waiting for us to get out. It was a weekday and I would bet money that they weren't sold out for the night to come because the weather was terrible but oh well. Overall it's a great vaule for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a pin last weekend of the season !”
Reviews.Author: LovesLauderdale
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last weekend of the season very little wear and tear on the room ( someone must be doing something right ) to keep the property so clean and maintained. Price was right and the location was good. Will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: karreyanne
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the hotel. The hotel itself appears very old and hasnt been updated. But it is a very clean hotel. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. For all the more time we actually spent in our room, what more could you want for the money! We had what was called and ocean view room- we could see the ocean but only looking to the left side when sitting out on the balcony. None the less for the money, I cant complain! I was very pleased- and would reccommend this hotel for anyone looking for a clean place to lay your head for a cheap price!

Reviews.Title: “Let's do the timewarp again! Good beach motel.”
Reviews.Author: MsTravellerEssex
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights at the Spinnaker for $702 (booked through hotel website). We chose the Spinnaker for nostalgia reasons; I used to stay here when I was a little girl with my parents and siblings, and was now with my husband and son (years and years later). It hasn't been updated much since then, but that's OK. The bathroom had a mustard yellow bathtub, sink and toilet, just as it did then. The shower temperature is not consistent. WiFi access is intermittent and extremely slow when connected (that's a new addition since I last stayed there!). However, I would definitely stay there again. As returning guests they gave us room 518 on the top floor of the north building, with lovely views. The staff were very welcoming - from check-in to the cleaning staff that greeted us (and remembered my son's name!) daily. The location is fantastic - it's 1/2 block away from the boardwalk; far enough away and quiet from the downtown attractions, but close enough to walk there without needing the $3 per person per trip tram. We loved renting bikes at 16th street in the mornings for our boardwalk jaunts. The Spinnaker is like visiting your favourite old dotty aunt; her house may not have been updated in awhile, but the welcome is warm and you wouldn't imagine staying anywhere else. Incidentally, there are new hotels on the beach since my last visit to Ocean City and new investment (prior to credit crunch?). I looked up the Holiday Inn next door for next year, and they wanted $499/night. Given the Spinnaker's price, and the fact that you wouldn't be in your room or at the pool all day anyway, I'd rather spend less and stay at the Spinnaker.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: savingyourlife74
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week in OCMD. We were down from Sunday till Friday. We got there Sunday around 11 didn't expect to be able to check in till 3 but went to check and we actually were able to. The room was clean and our view from our balcony was awesome. The only issue we had was a little problem with the keys but the office gave us new ones. The pool was very nice also. Housekeeper were very helpful and made sure we had the things we needed. We took most of our own food to make the only thing I would suggest is taking non stick pans we had a little problem with food sticking in the pans. For the price for the week it was a nice place to stay. Overall we had a wonderful week and are planning to book there next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Solid and Safe.”
Reviews.Author: xroll
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Ocean City, MD on August 2nd, 2008. I stayed for a total of 7 days at the Spinnaker Motel. I had friends with families staying in Ocean Village which is a little further away from the Boardwalk but I decided, as a single male, that I wanted a bit of privacy and be a little closer to the main strip. I chose the Spinnaker motel because of the location and the price seemed reasonable given the fact that it's essentially on the boardwalk. I ended up with a room in the north tower on the 5th floor. All I can say is that I was extremely pleased with the views and the sounds of crashing waves. The sunsets and sunrises were incredible and the room was very satisfactory for me. The maid service was excellent and I was always greeted with smile. (I even gave her the day off one day I was so pleased) :-P The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and I always felt very safe. I also had to get my card re-programmed a few times and it was never a problem. And, even though local calls were supposed to cost 50 cents or something, on check out, I was never charged a dime. Also, I REALLY enjoyed the fact that I could walk to the liquor store and get groceries in a matter on minutes. Dunkin Donuts is in the same little mall too. Honestly, if you're looking for something that is close to the action, but yet still quiet, I highly recommend this hotel. In fact, this was my first time in Ocean City and I'm already planning to return next year. Without question I'll be staying at the Spinnaker Motel again, but this time for 2 weeks. I'm not willing to risk picking a dud hotel for the next trip. Solid motel with a perfect location and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: TeresaMaryland
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh!!!! I don't know where to begin. We drove in to OC without reservations. After stopping at a few hotels with no success, we noticed the flashing neon vacancy sign. Now I see why! Check in was easy, but after that the trouble begins. First off, the office clerk didn't give us directions to the room, so we ended up in the wrong building. Turned out our building was across the parking lot. A parking space was easily found. As of now I wasn't to discouraged. THEN......we walked in the room. OH MY GOSH!!!!!! I couldn't believe it! I wanted to leave immediately, but when we signed in the check-in sheet states "NO Refunds". I seriously considered sleeping in my car. Anyway, as I checked the room over. The beds were first. DIRTY sheets! We immediately call the front desk for new sheets. As we're waiting for housekeeping, we noticed the dirty bathroom. It was apparent it was not cleaned. Soap pieces left in the tub from occupants before us, grime on the shower walls and the floor of the tub......needless to say, we showered in our flip flops. The refridgerator had spills in it and hairs on the door handle. The phone was dirty (dirtier than a typical hotel phone). The couch was so stained I wouldn't let my kids sit on it. The bedspreads (that I don't think hotels ever wash anyway) had stains all over them. And then there was the smell of mildew in the air. Okay, by this point housekeeping has arrived. She came in, looked at the sheets and proceeded to strip the beds. Throwing everything on the floor, including the pillows that we are supposed to be using for the night. Then she brings in some "clean" sheets. First of all, there is no fitted sheets. She went through at least 20 sets of sheets before she found ones acceptable to put on the bed. I am NOT exaggerating! My husband and I just looked at each other in astonishment. After the 1/2 hour of re-making our beds. We finally got out of there to see some attractions. I was dreading the thought of going back there for the evening, so I was trying to stay out as long as I could, but with 2 children it was a little difficult. Our last stop of the evening was to CVS so I could see if they had a sheet set for the beds. No luck there, but I did buy a tablecloth to lay across it so it wouldn't feel as gross. Back to the hotel we went and started getting our showers for the evening. I figured I'd better check the towels over since nothing else was clean and with no surprise, they felt damp and had plenty of hairs on them from previous occupants. YUCK!!!!!! Then to the shower (where I used the paper towels that I keep in my car for a wash cloth). And it was a good thing I didn't use all my clean beach towels. Wasn't expecting to have to use them for my shower. Then once you got in, the water would be hot and then cold as you showered. Nothing you could do at this point after you're all soaped up. After the lengthy measures of the shower taking, I finally was ready to use the hair dryer. I was 1/2 way through the drying and the power went out. I thought "NO WAY" , this has got to be a bad dream. So, my husband called down to the front desk and they asked if we were using more than two electronics at once (not knowing there was a limit), DUH on our part I guess. Only 1 piece of electronics at a time there! To make a long story short Which I did because there was a few other little things I left out, but I can't go on all night. I would never, ever stay here again! Unless you're bringing cleaning supplies and your own towels and sheets, don't waste your time!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, scary elevators”
Reviews.Author: hazelnut87
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Spinnaker from July 24th to July 29th. We were extremely lucky to get a room reserved only five or six days ahead of time, and the price was more than reasonable. The Spinnaker has many pros and cons to it, so I figured I'd write them all down since we read a ton of TripAdvisor reviews before we booked our vacation. Some PROS: 1. We reserved our room not even a week before our vacation and managed to get a great room -- top floor on the corner, where our balcony gave us views of the ocean, bay, and street. I really enjoyed hanging out on the balcony, although I wish they were fully private. The room also had a kitchen complete with an oven and refrigerator. Amenity-wise, we couldn't ask for much more (little bottles of shampoo and conditioner would have been nice since we forgot conditioner), especially considering the price. 2. The staff is extremely friendly. Housekeeping, the employees at the front desk, and maintenance were all warm and professional the entire time (except for a small mishap between me and the elevator, which I'll explain later). Housekeeping is especially great, the rooms are kept clean and our room was always cleaned before 1:00. 3. Great location. 18th Street is a great middle-ground between the often dirty, action-packed end of the boardwalk and the hotels up in the 50s and up. You're still on the boardwalk but it's not too crowded. Next door the Holiday Inn boasts two awesome outdoor pools as well as a rinse-off hose you can steal from time to time, and further down the Quality Inn (I think?) has a nice outdoor bar. Restaurants/buffets, CVS, Dunkin Donuts, liquor shops, and mini-golfing are all within easy walking distance to the Spinnaker. Some CONS: 1. The beds are absolutely terrible. I'm really not a picky person, and I was looking forward to claiming the pull-out sofa, but when I lay down on the mattress I could feel the metal springs pushing into me from below. Not being able to sleep on the pull-out sleeper definitely made our sleeping arrangements more complicated, and even so the beds were uncomfortable. The Spinnaker really should invest in new comfy mattresses -- if they did the rooms would have everything we asked for (except conditioner). Also they definitely aren't queen-size beds, more like doubles. 2. The elevators are scary, and yeah, I'm picky about elevators. I don't want to be riding in something that sounds like it's scraping against a concrete wall or moans or makes squeaky noises. All the guests tend to joke with each other in the elevators about how creepy they are, but I actually got stuck in one of them alone on the second day before we left for about 15, 20 minutes. I was stuck between the 4th and 5th floors, and the lights on all the buttons went off. I rang the alarm but got no response. Thank God I had my cell phone, because I called my brother and he ran out to the elevator and could hear me behind it. Both of us managed to crack open the doors about 1 cm wide, so at least he could talk me through the experience (AND so I could get some air -- the fan stayed on but it kept getting hotter and hotter), but all in all I am extremely claustrophobic and it ruined the day. Eventually somebody came, the elevator door was opened up and I had to climb up onto the 5th floor. The woman at the front desk ended up docking the bill for that day when my mom complained about the situation at check-out (nobody ever came to our room afterward, no apologies or anything until we complained), and the elevator I got stuck in was shut down for the rest of the time we were there -- and I only took the stairs -- but I still felt overlooked. It was just a crappy situation and I don't think they handled it the best they could. 3. The TV and free wifi both left something to be desired. We had a few power problems with the TV and had maintenance come twice to fix it, and we couldn't adjust the volume on HBO for some reason. Also for the wifi, I was initially given the wrong password, but after I got the password again the second day we only got between 1 and 2 bars of wireless reception from our 5th-floor room. I could check my email but not much more -- definitely couldn't go on AIM or be surfing the internet too long -- it was very slow, crappy reception. I tried to connect to another nearby wifi but they were also password-protected. 5th floor deserves good wireless reception just as much as the 1st floor! -- All in all the Spinnaker is worth the price. I would go back, but I'd probably take the stairs and bring a mattress pad. I loved the view from our corner balcony, I loved the women in housekeeping who were worrying alongside my family when I was trapped in the scary elevator. We all enjoyed the location. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: runnerchicky
Reviews.Content: My Family of 5 stayed at the Spinnaker Motel July 13th - 19th. The Motel is a must stay for any family it is very clean and spacious, there is a full size fridge and perfect sz stove as well as a microwave,3 steps to boadwalk, beautiful sideviews of the Ocean. We stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk the year before and thought that place was nice. But this place is by far better. the rooms are alot bigger then the quality Inn. The ocean view I think is musch better then the front view that we had at the qualtiy inn because your beach towels will never dry and its to musty. The front desk employees were very Very nice they deffinitly will give you the best rates available as well as treat you as their special guest. Highly recommend this motel to ALL PEOPLE.

Reviews.Title: “loving the spinnaker motel”
Reviews.Author: chriscatNj
Reviews.Content: We just got back from OC today and I was so happy when I left , that I felt I should write a review because I was a little nervous about our staying there. We use trip advisor before....... We were pleasantly surprise by this "motel". The room was spacious for 5 people, the room was verrrrrrry clean, even the top of the fridge and the pots were actually useable and clean....;). We loved the sun deck and the pool was a good size. We loved the poolside and oceanview you get with everyroom. The staff was greeeeat!!!!!! We will stay again. :) If you want a Motel Room Effic. this is the place to stay........Great for families......and others.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: blue-eyes-27-va
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we decided this would be an ok place to stay..........but we were so disappointed from the moment we entered our room. Check in was fast and friendly, the same with checking out. Our room was the problem, very worn out carpet, actually so worn and torn between the kitchen and bedroom part you could see the floor beneath the carpet, cob webs in the lamps, a big dead bug on the bathroom floor, not sure how the maid missed it. Another reason we picked the Spinnaker was becasue they advertise free internet access but we were never able to get on, most of the time there was no signal at all or very low signal....We called the front desk and they advised us to call their computer man whom never ansewered and never returned our call....we actually went to another hotel and asked if we could use their lobby and internet there and they had no problem with us doing that..and we had no problem getting on. On the plus side the room is a nice size and full fridge with small stove and microwave which was nice. A nice pool and sun deck. Yes I have read this is an older motel but it would be so much nicer if they would replace the old worn out dirty carpet, clean the rooms a little better and dont advertise internet access when there is no signal. For the money I will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: joeamy2007
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't suggest this hotel to anyone but some college students that are at OC to party. The rooms are very outdated and dirty. The carpeting was disgusting and there were cigar wrappers under the bed (non smoking room) and a bottle of something under the bed from someone prior to us. The mattresses are wore out. -nothing but springs They don't have fitted sheets -it's a flat sheet that doesn't fit the bed and as you sleep it rides up the bed. GROSS------- We bought clorox spray from CVS and wiped everything down. We wiped up the floor in the bathroom and it was black. If you want ice you have to buy your own somewhere else. They don't have an ice machine. The lady at the front desk said that's why we have ice trays in the freezer. WOW- 1 ice tray. We needed to iron clothes and there wasn't an iron and ironing board in the room. We had to call the front desk and I had to go down to the front office and get it myself. The office is across the parking lot in another building. I was asked to bring it back when I was done because they were full and other people would need it. Let's not forget the showers. It's hot then cold-hot-cold. You are either freezing to death or burnt up. Another woman in the reviews commented about the people standing around and smoking. Very true. There is a room next to the elevators and they sit in there and smoke. That's where all of the sheets and towels are kept. So basically all of that cigarette smoke is on your towels and sheets. Not good for people with allergies. Internet access- Good luck. They have internet but you won't be on there long before you are kicked off repeatedly. My husband had homework to do for an on line course and he got kicked off so frequently he had to quit. Parking- it's very tight and if it's super busy you had better not do too many trips-or you will not have a parking spot when you come back. If you choose to stay here- GOOD LUCK. I wish I had read more reviews prior to staying. On the positive side-not beach front but close and the pool was pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Still great after all of these years~”
Reviews.Author: BeachPirate1976
Reviews.Content: May 2008 marked my long return to OC. As a kid, I always stayed at The Spinnaker, so I figured that I'd give it another try. It was great...definitely worth the price. The front desk personnel was very friendly, the room was clean & when I had a problem with my TV, the problem was fixed in nearly minutes. Plus, being very close to the boardwalk was another added bonus! Definitely reccommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, bad towels”
Reviews.Author: bkhmd5
Reviews.Content: Overall, a nice experience - on the boardwalk, clean, not too outdated, etc. Really, my only complaint is that the towels were a polyester blend and they were really awful! They just did not dry very well and they just felt weird and cheap. I mean, I know the price is a bargain, but add on a couple of extra dollars and get some cotton towels!

Reviews.Title: “Quality oceanfront room for a not-so oceanfront price!!!”
Reviews.Author: caffeine371
Reviews.Content: We called and made reservations the day before our stay and the staff were so friendly! They quoted us a price over the phone that was lower than any other website offered and then lowered it again by another 20 bucks per night. They were more than happy to get us the best deal they could, and we weren't even asking! I had stayed in Ocean City several times before and I always thought the Spinnaker was unique-looking with its orange and blue decor. When we got to the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by how nice the rooms were. The bathroom was very nice and clean and the kitchenette was very convenient. I'm not sure if the hotel offered wireless internet or if we were taking it from a next door hotel, but nonetheless we did have internet access to look up restaurants and attractions in Ocean City. The best part was the location. Although the hotel can't say they are a boardwalk hotel, they are 1/2 block off the boardwalk, still with beautiful ocean views from the rooms. We really enjoyed sitting on our balcony in the evening, being able to see and hear the ocean. It was so nice to be able to walk out of our hotel and be just steps away from the beach and the ocean. The best was when we were done, we could walk right off the beach to the pool. The location of the hotel is also very convenient to all the shops and attractions on the boardwalk, being right in the middle. You don't have to drive anywhere really. One small complaint is that the pool did close pretty early, and I wish we could've gone for a night swim. Also, the hotel didn't have laundry which we could have used. The room was clean enough for me, but maybe a little sandy and damp, which I expected anyway from an oceanfrontish room. Also, wish they had king-size beds. A quality oceanfront room for a not-so oceanfront price!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: ocfan
Reviews.Content: This motel was such a great surprise...a diamond in the rough! We stayed from Sept 3rd till the 6th. We had more in that room than any room in a high class place. Never had to buy ice..just kept on filling the trays and filling our cooler! The room was spotless and the staff was so friendly and helpful. We only went to the cafe once and that wasn't a great experience...but there are a million other places to go. We left clothes in the room when we left and I called and the woman at the front desk was so great about it and sent them to us right away! Thanks!!! We'll be back next year for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ksti99
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at this motel and it was terrific. There are many dumpy hotels/motels at the beach, but this is NOT one of them. We arrived very early to get extra beach time. I checked in and to my suprise the room was all ready :) The staff at the counter were the nicest people I have ever seen at a motel. Very polite, and very willing to help in anyway possible! Our Room was very clean, great mini efficiency, 2 beds with a pull out sofa bed. Hotel is in a Great Location! Within walking distance to quite a few good restaurants and a great Bar - The Paddock just down the block. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone. If you are looking for a Ritzy ,Ocean Front, 5 star hotel, then you might look elsewhere. This motel is ocean view, clean and affordable, and for my vacation that suites just fine :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: oceancitydreamgirl
Reviews.Content: I just came ack August 17th from a week stay at the Spinnaker Motel 1800 Baltimore Ave in the Block. As soon as I got there this year I noticed a lot more help than last year. They hose the parking and flower gradens several times a day including late at night. The steps, elevators were spotless. The rooms were very clean and smelled clean right from the get go. We stayed in the North building which is not the front desk buildingand it is so maintained and clean. The housekeeping staff is there early every am and our housekeeper on 2nd floor in the north building did a great excellent job. I was very pleased this year. It seems as though they have more cleaning staff this year than last. The pool and the large pool area is just the cleanest I have seen and I have did a lot of walking this year and checked out other properties on my travels. The Cafe is another great thing. The 2 waitresses are great and quick for such a busy place. The prices are great and the food tastes great. I like the balcony. The Spinnaker does have private balconies there are dividers up if you see other properties on along the ocean front they don't have that. There are balconies but most do not have dividers. I can not wait to book next years trip. The Spinnaker is also in a great location too. Right by the CVS and a liquor store and some great coffee at Dunkin Donuts. 3 blocks from Phillips all you can eat Seafood buffet too. The front desk staff is just wonderful and amazing here as well. I will be hear next year.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance”
Reviews.Author: avalongirl2
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel to stay if you want to rock out at the Big Kahuna/Paddock whatever you want to call it. Within walking distance, no worries of driving home late night. Great place to stay. Employee there are the nicest I have seen in a while. Always a smile on their faces.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: ginamisdemeanor
Reviews.Content: Went to OC June 24-28. Hotel was nice, clean, and staff was friendly. The place has wifi and a kitchenette. The balconies were nice but not totally private. No ice machine, but maybe that's the norm? Also, no complementary shampoo (just fyi). Good hotel for the price, I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Roomhopper01
Reviews.Content: Very nice motel....... We are a family of five and there was more then enough bed space in one room. There needs to be some remodeling in the bathroom and kitchenette area, but if it raises the cost, they can leave it just how it is. All in all our trip was very enjoyable. That's my spot every year from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Priced, Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: toyami
Reviews.Content: Just got back on Sunday 9/24 from a week at OC staying at the Spinnaker. What a great place to stay. We were on the 4th floor & could see the ocean & the bay from our balcony. The staff was amazing. We couldn't have asked for a better vacation. If anyone is looking for a great clean place to stay for a reasonable price try the Spinnaker, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at great location”
Reviews.Author: wildlife_lover
Reviews.Content: Who we are: We are a family of 4, with 2 teenagers. Have been to Ocean City many times before and love it. Like to stay on the boardwalk. Have never been at Spinaker before. Lousy start - We had reserved 2 rooms and when we arrived they told us they had made a mistake and only put us in the system for one! They were able to find another room, but it took around half an hour. Good points - Location, location, location. The motel is not right on the boardwalk, but is just behind another hotel that is. No streets to cross caryying your stuff to the beach. They said all rooms had oceanview balconies and they did. I appreciate they didn't lie and call it oceanfront. Also, if you look the other way you could see the bay. nice. Also, you can walk to everything. 18th St is relatively quiet, but just a couple blocks from where the restaurants and shops start. Rooms were extra large and included a kitchenette and dining area. Everything was clean and working - air conditioning, shower etc. Lousy end - They said they had a changing room, and they did, but there was no shower. Not a good last impression. All told though, a pleasant and convenient place to stay and prices were reasonable by OC standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: we B travlin'
Reviews.Content: We booked our room only two days in advance. We arrived mid morning & they offered to call us on our cell phone if our room was ready before 3:00 check-in. The few employees we encountered were very pleasant, some inquiring if they could help us with anything. Important to us was the fact that our room was very clean- I even checked the corners. Would we stay there again? yes

Reviews.Title: “You might lose your deposit!!”
Reviews.Author: rondekel
Reviews.Content: This motel had many wonderful comments written about it...myself and another party booked a room for July and found out we must cancel..these people are now charging us $25.00 per room to cancel when it's well over a month away and they can rent these rooms out many times over!! I am tired of paying these horrendous Ocean City prices to begin with and now this is the limit. ...anyway, if you book this motel make darn sure you can go or you will be charged 25.00, even if you cancel in the next half hour!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I go to Ocean City every summer as a ritual. Two years ago we stayed at the Spinnaker for the first time and loved it! It is clean, the personnel are friendly and the rates are very reasonable. Last year we were unfortunately unable to get reservations for the time frame that we needed so we had to stay at another motel. The place was nice enough but did not compare to the Spinnaker. This year we already have our reservations made to stay there in June and we can't wait! I'd recommend the Spinnaker, and have, to all my friends. Keep up the good work!
